text: Plarasa or Plarassa was an inland town of ancient Caria, inhabited during Roman times. At some point it, along with Tauropolis, became part of the territory of the Antiochia ad Maeandrum, after which an aqueduct which was built by Marcus Ulpius Carminius Claudianus (husband of Carminia Ammia) in the 2nd century to supply the combined community.Encyclopedia Britannica (1911), vol. 2, "Aqueduct". Its site is located near Bingeç in Asiatic Turkey. ==References== Category:Populated places in ancient Caria Category:Former populated places in Turkey Category:Roman towns and cities in Turkey Category:History of Aydın Province Category:Karacasu District
title: Plarasa
